com.thoughtworks.robot
Class Robot

java.lang.Object
  com.thoughtworks.robot.Robot
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseRobot
public abstract class Robot
extends java.lang.Object

A Robot which represents an actual robot instance which can planted on Plateau. A robot always has a state (X,Y or Z values and direction) which is represented by Location.

Author:
sshinde
See Also:
BaseRobot, Location, Plateau, BasePlateau

Constructor Detail

Robot

public Robot(java.lang.String startLocationString,
             MoveParser moveParser,
             LocationParser locationParser,
             Plateau plateau)
      throws InvalidLocationString
Public constructor which creates a Robot instance. A robot can not be created without its current location, MoveParser, LocationParser and Plateau

Parameters:
startLocationString - Location string (e.g. 1 1 E) for Robot.
moveParser - MoveParser which helps Robot to interpret the move commands (e.g. L, M , R)
locationParser - LocationParser which helps Robot to interpret location strings (1 1 E)
plateau - Plateau /area in which this robot should be planted.
Throws:
InvalidLocationString

moveRobot

public abstract void moveRobot(java.util.Collection<Robot> otherRobots,
                               java.lang.String stringCommand)
A method which must be implemented by all other Robot classes (BaseRobot) to move a robot on Plateau.

Parameters:
otherRobots - Other Robot(s) on same Plateau
stringCommand - command string for robot to move on Plateau
See Also:
BaseRobot

resetRobotLocation

public abstract void resetRobotLocation()
A method which must be implemented by all other Robot classes (BaseRobot) to tell how to reset the state Location of Robot.

See Also:
BaseRobot
